result.execSummary:
The defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).
  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).
  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges by 03-22-2018. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- DNA sample be taken.
Credit for 90 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: 
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV surcharge by 03-22-2018. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- DNA sample be taken, assessment waived due to paying on count 1.
Credit for 90 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Credit for 26 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

records.addlTxt:
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:
- Court sentences defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 90 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges by 03-22-2018. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- DNA sample be taken.

AS TO COUNT 2:
- Court sentences defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 90 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV surcharge by 03-22-2018. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- DNA sample be taken, assessment waived due to paying on count 1.

AS TO COUNT 3:
- Court sentences defendant to serve 26 days in the House of Correction with credit for 26 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV surcharge by 03-22-2018. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- DNA sample be taken, assessment waived due to paying on count 1.

* Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief.

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm
Case calendared for jury trial, parties have reached a resolution.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, and 3:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez not in court, in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for status conference. Defense request a jury trial date only. 
All parties notified, effective August 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, in room 423 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Jury trial scheduled for March 22, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Speedy trial demand.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with C.S. (DOB 8/19/93)  mn
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez not in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. Any bail on deposit is to be forfeited. Court VACATES Jury Trial date.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Crystal S. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26191204 in court 2x on 1/13/16, 1/14/16.

16RM003917  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-26-2016

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned until after defendant's felony matter resolves due to reasons placed on the record. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 1/21/16 for Crystal S. for 2 appearances on 1/13/16, 1/14/16.

Official Transcript Excerpt of Hearing held on 01-13-2016, before the Honorable Janet Protasiewicz, filed 
(8 pages).
Witness fee request prepared for Crystal, S. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Discussion of second motion from defense for a Mistrial placed on the record. Court granted defense request for a Mistrial. All conditions of bail remain. Court ordered case adjourned for a Status Conference. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State orally requests Criminal Complaint to read:
Count 1: On 5/25/2015
Count 2: On 5/25/2015
Count 3:On 5/27/2015
Count 4: On 6/1/2015
Court grants state request. 

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 2:09 pm. Jury out of the box at 3:18 pm. Jury in the box at 3:37. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Witnesses sequestered. Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense. Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Crystal S. and Officer Joseph Morgano. Jury out of box at 4:36 pm. Off record discussions placed on the record. Defense mistrial motions placed on the record. Court held ruling on motions in abeyance. Case adjourned to 1/14/2016 at 8:30 am.
Second call- appearances remain the same. State's final offer placed on the record. Defendant rejects final offer. Case passed to 1:30 pm to begin Jury Trial.

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. First call-Parties ready for trial. Discussion of jury instructions placed on the record. Case passed to address court calendar.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail hearing waived.  Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with CS dob 8/19/93

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
   Defendant is advised  case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for jury trial.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 10/05/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.
